reviews.review: If you like doom you'll love this game. This is a co-op survival horror game which players have to work together on getting to the end of each level by defeating a boss at the end after shooting up tons of specimens that have diffrent ablities and come in all sizes. So if you can't get enough of doom and you want to play a title like it, then this game is for you.
This game reminds me of Cannibal Corpse. That is the highest possible accolade I can give to a co-op zombie game.

Killing floor is another counterstrike / half:life style team based shootem up. But this time your not playing against other online players, this time its you and your mates against an overwealming zombie force. Immediately this rings the left 4 dead fimiliarity bell, but as of yet i have not played left or dead so i can honestly say i dont know the similaritys. 
Every now and then a gamer can be lucky enough to stumble on a cult game in the making with a rich local following, and this is one of those games.
The atmosphere in-game is scarey, foreboding and frantic, and can send you running for your life when caught of guard. And to be honest spraying mutant zombieness everywhere with my auto-shotgun brings on a deal of satisfaction. And ensures this game will be very popular and will continue to be played as long as there are people online playing it. 

Its 8.8 Out of 10 for me.
Bonne alternative Ã  left 4 dead

A pretty fun game, dispite the somewhat slow load times for entering a server. While the 6-man originals are alright, you really want the custom servers with upwards of 20-30 ppl or more. Then, not only are the waves huge, but its just more fun with more players. Watch out for the Patriarch! ^^

A thrilling co-op game that works basically like a Horde mode. You run around maps as different classes (called perks) and kill these zombie-like ZEDs. They are experimented on humans gone through various tests and torture by a scientist now known as The Patriarch.

You reach the last wave and you will verse him. Once you know his tactics, he gets fairly easy to avoid but if you are new to the game I would strongly suggest playing with other people you know.
This game is fun with friends and can be with randoms as well.

The perk selection you get is quite vast and with the amount of DLC and support that Tripwire Interactive did for this game (for about 5-10 years or so if I recall) there is so much to choose from.

Perks include:

Commando (Assault Rifle type class)
Sharpshooter (Sniper class)
Berserker (Melee class)
Firebug (Flamethrower class)

and so much more...

Different perks can be ideal for different situations. Tired of those pesky crawlers? Go Firebug and set the ground ablaze! Finding those Stalkers annoying? Go Commando and spot them before they can even get to you! Having trouble with Fleshpounders? Go Support, grab a shotgun and let them have it!
Can't control Scrakes? Go Berserker and learn the moves of swaying back and move, hitting particular buttons like mouse3 and mouse2 and effectively combat and stun your enemy.
Don't like taking the Scrakes or Fleshpounders up close but wanna see some limbs fly? Go Demolitionist, put some mines down, grab a grenade launcher, cover your entrances and exits and you'll be sittin' pretty for a long time! Sure it's counted as camping but what doesn't kill you makes you smarter right?

This game in short summary can be summed up in these 3 points:
- Fun with friends and others.
- Tons of variety and choice!
- Very addictive!

I recommend this game highly!
The best game ever when you have good friends to play it with.
The best zombie-related game ever made, if you enjoy killing countless zeds. If you'd rather run away from them like a small dog, get Left 4 Dead.

Ah, Killing Floor--a traditional zombie game, if all the uninfected survivors were smart-arsed British people. Don't go thinking that just because you have guns, chainsaws, and flamethrowers, that you can just go charging into the meaty hordes, or else you'll end up a greasy bloodstain on the floor surrounded by gear to loot. Fight effectively, work with your team, and always watch your backs. There are an awful lot of zeds around and ammunition is a scarce commodity, but if you're lucky, there'll be some new guns or a nice ax to liven up your blood-filled day. Watch out for the screaming, cloaking, crawling, puking, flaming, slashing, chainsawing hordes that are out for your blood, and don't get too comfortable hiding in a corner and letting them all come to you. The game helpfully reminds you why with its lovely mangled-corpse decor behind desks, in corners, and basically any place you thought you could hide safely. Don't just stand around working your gob, mate. It's not safe...

If you want a challenging and quite gory FPS then this is the game. Extremely hardcore combat against waves of all sorts of mutated beasties. Comes with a sandbox mode to really challenge yourself when you get sick of dying repeatedly on normal mode. The game does NOT have an easy mode.
Think of a first person alien swarm, weilding and all, cool weapon system and all around fun game, if you can find ppl to play with, still a decent ammount of ppl online in servers

One of the best co-op games you can get here on Steam.
With a wide range of weapons, colorful characters and unqiue enemies, you simply can't miss this wonderful gem.
Between each wave that you survive, you are able to visit a merchant, that travels around the map, who will sell you weapons as well as armor and ammo, but you can't buy and carry all the weapons as there is a weight limit so you must plan accordingly and make sure you don't waste the hard earned money on a gun that proves to be next to useless in the next wave.
You are able to select from a number of different perks that each offer their own strengths and weakness, for example the Medic perk will allow you to restore more of your teammates' health while also recharging the syringe more quickly and also give you a discount on bodyarmor at the merchant as well as being able to move around a bit quicker then the others.
These perks can be leveled up to increase the effectivness of these advantages and it is highly recommended that you check the perk menu for the requirements as to how you level them up.
And lets not forget the fact that most of the characters you can play as speak with the cockney dialect, which has also been used most notably by the Orks in the Warhammer 40K universe as well as the Merchant from Resident Evil 4 and other games, which adds even more humor to the game.

Seriously, pick this game up next time it's on sale. It's a fun little zombie game. It's gameplay is a mix between the mob slaying zombie shoot-em-up feel of L4D, with a bit of Counter Strike and a dash of leveling up your perks. It'll statisfy both hardcore zombie fans and FPS players.

Killing Floor is a co-op game, where you can play alone, about experiments gone wrong and invading London (and the world too as seen in KF2 and as seen on some KF maps). Your goal is to survive 4,7 or 10 waves of enemies, while earning money by killing them (or by healing your teammates) so that you can buy powerful weapons during the minute of calm at the trader between the waves. After, you'll have to defeat the Patriarch, who is the sole responsible for the chaos. You can choose different difficulties: Easy (which is really to learn the game), Normal, Hard, Suicidal and Hell on Earth.

Enemies are thougher depending on the difficulty but you too can evolve and acquire advantages like spawning with a better weapon than a pistol or armor thanks to the level system. You have 6 of them and it takes time. However, you have different classes: medic (no powerful weapon but more resistance  and better health), commando (rifles and can see stalkers from apart), support (big guns and better welder), demo (everything that is explosive), berserker (melee and also can't be grabbed), sharpshooter (sniper and headshots more efficient) and firebug (flame everywhere).

Enemies are varied: from the simple Zed to the infamous Fleshpound that can kill you quickly, without forgetting the Scrake and the chainsaw, the Gorefast that cuts you in pieces, the Crawler that loves your feet, the Stalker who is hidden, the Husk that launches fireballs, the Siren that is hurting your ears (and your health)....

Anyway, the game in its actual state contains many maps (some are official, others done by modders) and mutators with Christmas-themed or Halloween-Themed or Circus-Themed enemies (because they were parts of special events). The maps are very varied: fair, tunnel of love, Santa's workshop or cave, asylum, Horzine labs, urban town, mountain, hospital, etc..

But you'll ask me: what about the DLC? Well, all the DLC are cosmetic. True, you have new weapons in them and they can be used for achievements. However, you can do them with the standard weapons, that are enough like the AA12 for example. And you can unlock avatars by playing with themed mutators for example or owning other games. And that's how you own two Mr Foster (the normal and the steampunk).

Killing Floor in solo holds interest if you want to level without having a team to check or to win map achievements in Normal/Hard. An higher difficulty is better with a team, however, keep in mind that some of the players aren't using the perks for the team but for themselves. I've seen many medics choosing this perk for the advantages it's giving in terms of resistance or health but not healing at all the team for example. It's annoying as hell and if I seems to be upset by this kind of behavior, it's because I'm a medic first in this game, because I feel more useful by healing my teammates than beginning to put pipe bombs, welding the right doors or being a specialist of the crossbow. Healing is important in that game and if a medic is there, he's more powerful for the heal than the rest of the team. Not using of that fact can result in premature death on high difficulty.

Anyway, with Killing Floor 2, I don't know if there are still a lot of players there. I still need to win Suicidal and Hell on Earth achievements, as I've all Hard and Normal and that all my perks are lvl5+. But it's still worthy to play. As long as there are servers and as long as the solo mode is there, Killing Floor is really a very strong co-op game. However, make sure that you're not discouraged when level 0. By patience, by learning and by leveling, you'll find more and more pleasure to survive these waves.

I paid $7 for this game and have logged almost 300 hours playing it. I play it solo, I play it with strangers on the internet, I play it with friends in private games. I was a big fan of the Invasion mode of UT2004, and Killing Floor satisfies in similar fashion, plus an addicting progression system for the various classes. I have mixed feelings about that last part, as I am easily susceptible to such systems but I suspect they make my experience less enjoyable in the end.

Like to kill zombies? Like intense teamplay? Like gore and interesting gameplay mechanics? Then Killing Floor is something for you. If you are searching for awesome graphics KF will not satisfy you, but that doesn't mean it looks bad. It's just a little outdated.
